text: <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a C2H2 zinc finger gene encoding a putative transcriptional regulator of myeloid differentiation .

The <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein contains 13 C2H2 zinc fingers arranged in bipartite DNA binding domains containing zinc fingers through 4 and , in the carboxy-terminus , 5 through 13 .
We previously identified the DNA consensus binding site recognized by the two DNA binding domains .

To assess the transcription regulatory function of <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the full-length <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> coding region was fused to the DNA binding domain of the yeast transactivator <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The expression vector was cotransfected with the <extra_id_0> chloramphenicol acetyl transferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) reporter gene regulated by the <extra_id_0> thymidine kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter containing <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA binding sites into NIH 3T3 , 293 , K562 , and Jurkat cell lines .

text: The <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites are present in the promoters of several genes expressed during myeloid differentiation , including the <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
<extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcriptional regulation of this physiologically relevant promoter was assessed in both hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cell lines .

Recombinant <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein specifically binds to the consensus binding sites in the <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in mobility shift assays .

text: <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vectors were cotransfected with the luciferase reporter plasmids regulated by the <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter into both nonhematopoietic and hematopoietic cell lines .

As with the heterologous DNA binding domain , <extra_id_0> MZF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> represses reporter gene expression in nonhematopoietic cell lines and activates expression in hematopoietic cell lines .
